citation: Registration to Work with Vulnerable People Amendment (Regulated Activities) Regulations (No. 2) 2016 (Tas)
text:
Registration to Work with Vulnerable People Amendment (Regulated Activities) Regulations (No. 2) 2016

I, the Governor in and over the State of Tasmania and its Dependencies in the Commonwealth of Australia, acting with the advice of the Executive Council, make the following regulations under the Registration to Work with Vulnerable People Act 2013 .

29 November 2016

C. WARNER

Governor

By Her Excellency's Command,

DR VANESSA GOODWIN

Minister for Justice

PART 1 - Preliminary

1. Short title
    These regulations may be cited as the Registration to Work with Vulnerable People Amendment (Regulated Activities) Regulations (No. 2) 2016 .

2. Commencement
        (1) Except as provided by this regulation, these regulations take effect on 1 January 2017.
        (2) Part 3 takes effect on 1 March 2017.

PART 2 - Registration to Work with Vulnerable People Regulations 2014 Amended

3.
    The amendments effected by this Part have been incorporated into the authorised version of the Registration to Work with Vulnerable People Regulations 2014 .

4.
    The amendments effected by this Part have been incorporated into the authorised version of the Registration to Work with Vulnerable People Regulations 2014 .

5.
    The amendments effected by this Part have been incorporated into the authorised version of the Registration to Work with Vulnerable People Regulations 2014 .

PART 3 - Registration to Work with Vulnerable People Regulations 2014 Further Amended

6. Principal Regulations
    In this Part, the Registration to Work with Vulnerable People Regulations 2014 are referred to as the Principal Regulations.

7.
    The amendment effected by this regulation has been incorporated into the authorised version of the Registration to Work with Vulnerable People Regulations 2014 .

Displayed and numbered in accordance with the Rules Publication Act 1953.

Notified in the Gazette on 7 December 2016

These regulations are administered in the Department of Justice.
